description:
NV Jeio Prosecco Brut (Veneto, Italy) $14- Soft, fruity and refreshing sparkling wine with pear and floral aromas
NV Veuve Clicquot 'Yellow Label' Brut (Reims, France) $23- Distinct orange, melon, and honey taste- Slight sweetness balanced by clean acidity.
NV Moët & Chandon Rosé Impérial (Epernay, France) $28- Bright fruit flavor- elegant maturity- seductive palate

2018 Pinot Grigio, 'Riff', Progetto Lageder (Tre Venezie, Italy) $11- Pure white fruity flavor of pear and melon.
2018 Sauvignon Blanc, 'Frenzy', Paua Bay Wines (Marlborough, New Zealand) $13- Paired with our Seafood Melange- Refreshing fruity and herby flavor- Dry.
2017 Chardonnay, 'Oak Knoll District', Trefethen (Napa, California) $17- Buttery and complex taste- hints of Asian Pear and honey dew.

2018 Rosé, 'Méditerranée', Triennes (Provence, France) $13- Crisp and fruity with red currant brightness. An acidic and tangy citrus rosé.
2018 Rosato di Aglianico, éVetereé, San Salvatore (Campania, Italy) $17- Rich and fruity in flavor; usually paired with white meat.

2015 Côtes-du-Rhône, Les Cassagnes de La Nerthe (Rh√¥ne Valley, France) $15- Paired well with a variety of meats and cheese- freshness of dark fruit flavor with some spicy notes, finished with lingering notes of lavender.
2016 Cabernet Sauvignon, Avalon (Napa, California) $14- Paired with XL Ribeye Steak- Acidic and red fruity flavor.
2015 Margaux, Château Paveil de Luze (Bordeaux, France) $23- Best served with classic meat dishes. Earthy, floral, and tobacco flavors- soft in texture.
2017 Pinot Noir, 'Les Ursulines', Jean-Claude Boisset (Burgundy, France) $17- Paired with Filet Mignon- High level of acid- delicate in nature with a high berry profile.
